TopicTitle: What little thing do YOU think should be added to KSP?

1 minute ago, Andem said:

I got the little notification in the corner of my screen... 

Oh, ok.
Display of coordinate axes, node detectors in every orbit (with possibility choose reference plane (ecliptic, equator of center body, target orbit (it exist already)).
Be able to select a kerbal/ship/flag directly without [ and ] That would be a nice little improvement.
A stock DeltaV meter (and other data readouts like KER and MJ)

I'd like to be able to set parachutes to deploy at a certain velocity instead of altitude. Maybe a combination of both, for instance: Deploy at 200 m/s OR 500 m. This would make it easier to recover things like boosters without having to focus on the particular object you are trying to land.
Removed some posts. Keep the discussions on-topic, please.

I would like Surface Sample animation.

Edit: I can imagine how would we take water samples...

Edit 2: Maybe plastic bags?

Edited February 19, 2016 by Djolox

Explosions with small bits flying down with a small trail behind them, like the black smoke plumes in old KSP, only instead of being black and opaque, they are white and semi transparent. Like real life rocket explosions with the bits of fuel coming down.

I would like the lighting to be changed, so that not only solar power efficiency goes down, but also the lighting,

Just like pluto is very far away from the sun and in turn dim, Eeloo should also be fairly dim.

I think there should be something where you can be in first person mode with Kerbals and be able to move around the cabin, like if you were in a space station.

and with that, there should come some better viewing cupolas, or a glass structural fuselage so that Kerbals can see what's outside. With first person and a view of the inside of the cabin, you could also have an interesting EVA, maybe depressurization and the opening of the hatch to the vacuum of space, or to the planet you're on. Could also be for transferring Kerbals from different ships

Edited February 21, 2016 by silverfaceofhell

When you're IVA, lets say when plummeting to Kerbin or rising out of it, you should be able to hear takeoff rattling noises or something. Also maybe a thump when you dock and maybe when you land as well with the landing legs. If its with wheels, maybe the landing sound that planes make when the wheels touch down.

Rover wheels could leave tracks in the dust, and Kerbals could leave footprints, which would stay for a long time on non-atmospheric bodies. However, this would likely have to take into account the material the surface is made of. For instance, tracks on Eeloo would look different from tracks on the Mun because Eeloo's surface is different from the Mun's.

Being able to collide with terrain scatter.

Also, buildings as terrain scatter.

On 2/21/2016 at 0:44 PM, AeronautEdward said:

I'd like to be able to delete craft while looking at them, rather than having to remember their names, go to the tracking station, and delete them from there.

I'd also like a taller 1.25m service bay/cargo bay.  There are times when I'd like to bring along just a bit more equipment, or taller equipment.

Another thing that would be nice: air intakes (and engines) that vary their drag based on how much air is being ingested/expelled.  Throttle the engines up, and the drag from the intakes decreases.

Part welding wherever two tanks meet with the same size nodes.  2.5m tanks weld together, 2.5m tanks weld with 2.5m-to-1.25m adapters, etc.

Fuel venting.  So if you end up in orbit with some leftover oxidizer and a LV-N, you don't have to lug around useless oxidizer for the rest of your mission.

Ground effect, so landings are a bit easier
